neighbors.name: Blue Star Dairy Farms
neighbors.claims: Blue Star Dairy Farms, founded in 1946 by the Meinholz family, is a major dairy operation milking over 2,100 cows across locations in DeForest and Arlington [Mid-West Farm Report](https://www.midwestfarmreport.com/2024/05/14/blue-star-dairy-farms-is-your-host/). The farm is a community pillar, selected to host the 2024 Dane County Breakfast on the Farm [Dane County Dairy](https://www.danecountydairy.com/breakfast-on-the-farm/). While the farm participates in renewable energy by supplying manure to a biodigester that generates electricity [Town of Springfield](https://www.town.springfield.wi.us/wp-content/uploads/Comp-Plan-Amended-6.6.23_w-maps-and-appendices-2.pdf), the owners have expressed concern that large-scale solar projects compete for the leased farmland essential to their feed and manure management operations [Madison Commons](https://madisoncommons.org/massive-solar-project-could-change-the-landscape-in-rural-dane-county/).
neighbors.influence_justification: Major dairy farm; hosts county breakfast events

approach_recommendations.engage: Utilize an agricultural liaison to discuss how the project can avoid disrupting their critical leased land base, while acknowledging their existing contribution to renewable energy via biogas.

citations.claim: Blue Star Dairy Farms, founded in 1946 by the Meinholz family, is a major dairy operation milking over 2,100 cows across locations in DeForest and Arlington
citations.title: Blue Star Dairy Farms Is Your Host

citations.claim: The farm is a community pillar, selected to host the 2024 Dane County Breakfast on the Farm
citations.title: Breakfast on the Farm | Dane County Dairy Promotion Committee

citations.claim: While the farm participates in renewable energy by supplying manure to a biodigester that generates electricity
citations.title: Town of Springfield Comprehensive Plan Amended 2023

citations.claim: the owners have expressed concern that large-scale solar projects compete for the leased farmland essential to their feed and manure management operations
citations.title: Massive solar project could change the landscape in rural Dane County

neighbors.name: Cynthia M. LaValley
neighbors.claims: Cynthia M. LaValley is a co-owner of agricultural property at 7684 Patton Road alongside Gerald R. Hahn [Town of Vienna](https://www.apraz.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/03/T.-Vienna-2024-Completed-Real-Estate-Assessment-Roll-1.pdf). The property is situated in the DeForest school district and is classified for agricultural use [Town of Vienna](https://www.apraz.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/03/T.-Vienna-2024-Completed-Real-Estate-Assessment-Roll-1.pdf). She does not appear to hold public office or have a documented stance on renewable energy development in public meeting minutes or local news [Town of Vienna](https://www.viennawi.gov/).
neighbors.influence_justification: Private agricultural landowner; no public role found

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage via a respectful, private approach, potentially including co-owner Gerald R. Hahn, emphasizing the preservation of the property's agricultural character and rural viewshed.

citations.claim: Cynthia M. LaValley is a co-owner of agricultural property at 7684 Patton Road alongside Gerald R. Hahn
citations.title: Town of Vienna 2024 Completed Real Estate Assessment Roll

citations.claim: The property is situated in the DeForest school district and is classified for agricultural use
citations.title: Town of Vienna 2024 Completed Real Estate Assessment Roll

citations.claim: She does not appear to hold public office or have a documented stance on renewable energy development
citations.title: Town of Vienna Official Website
